question.content: The Beating Retreat ceremony is held at which of the following places?

solution.content: Vijay Chowk (Delhi). It is conducted every year on the evening of 29 January. It is a long-standing tradition of paramilitary forces, when troops returned to their camps after the war, Ð° program of entertaining band playing was organized to reduce the tension of the war.

question.content: Who takes the salute during the Republic Day parade at New Delhi?

solution.content: President. Republic Day parade takes place every year on 26 January at Kartavya Path (Former Raj Path), New Delhi. The parade marches from the Rashtrapati Bhavan on the Kartavya Path to India Gate and from there to Red Fort. It opens with the unfurling of the national flag by the President of India. This is followed by marching from several regiments of the Army, Navy, and Air Force, along with their bands. tableaux from various states signifying their cultures are displayed. A beating retreat ceremony signifies the end of the parade.

question.content: The Rajpath was decided to be a permanent venue for the Republic Day parade from which of the following year onwards?

solution.content: 1955. The initial four Republic day parades were held at different places that were Irwin Amphitheatre, Kingsway, Red Fort and Ramlila Maidan respectively between 1950 to 1954. The French army was the first foreign army to participate in India's Republic Day Parade in 2016 (67th Republic day). The chief guest of the first Republic Day Parade was the President of Indonesia Sukarno was the chief guest.

question.content: Who among the following singers became the first Indian folk artist to attend the Cannes Film Festival 2022?

solution.content: Mame Khan An Indian Rajasthani folk singer who is known for his Sufi and folk music performances. Cannes Film Festival (Festival de Cannes) A film festival held annually in Cannes (France). First held 1946. The festival came to provide a rendezvous for those interested in the art and influence of the movies.

question.content: What was the theme of Independence Day in the year 2015 in India?

solution.content: Towards True Freedom. It was the 69th Independence Day of India. Themes of following Independence day: 2019 Support our Troops, Salute our Troops; 2020 Atma Nirbhar Bharat; 2021, 22, 23 - Nation First, Always First.

question.content: Reni Village in Garhwal was known for what movement in 1970? environmental

solution.content: Chipko movement. Sunderlal Bahuguna gave the movement the proper direction. Save Silent Valley was a social movement (in 1973) aimed at the protection of Silent Valley, Palakkad district of Kerala, India. In the early 1980s, the Jungle Bachao Andolan (Singhbhum District, Jharkhand) and the Appiko Movement forest-based environmental movements (Uttara Kannada district of Karnataka in the Western Ghats).

question.content: Which Indian finance minister was India's delegate to the World Monetary Conference at Bretton Woods in 1944?

solution.content: RK Shanmukham Chetty. He was an Indian lawyer, economist, and politician who served as independent India's first finance minister from 1947 to 1948.

question.content: In which year the post of National Security Advisor created in India?

solution.content: 1998. Brajesh Mishra was appointed as the first National Security Advisor of India. Ajit Kumar Doval is the current National Security Advisor of India.

question.content: In which year was the first meeting of the National Integration Council held?

solution.content: 1962. The National Integration Council (NIC) is a group of senior politicians and public figures in India that looks for ways to address the problems of communalism, casteism, and regionalism.

question.content: In which of the following years was the National Food Security Act enacted in India?

solution.content: 2013. National Food Security Act The Act legally entitled 75% of the rural population and 50% of the urban population to receive subsidized food grains under Targeted Public Distribution System.

question.content: In which year was 'Ramlila' inscribed on the UNESCO Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity?

solution.content: 2008. UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage India - Ramman (2009), Chhau dance, Kalbelia, Mudiyettu (2010), Buddhist chanting of Ladakh (2012), Sankirtana (2013), Traditional brass and copper craft of utensil making among the Thatheras of Jandiala Guru, Punjab (2014), Nouroz, yoga (2016), Kumbh Mela (2017), Durga puja (2021).

question.content: The first Star Guild Awards ceremony was held in Mumbai in the year:

solution.content: 2004. The first Star Guild Awards: It is awarded for excellence in film and television by members of the Producers Guild.

question.content: The first Indian satellite, Aryabhata, was launched on 19 April_.

solution.content: 1975. Named after a famous Indian astronomer Aryabhata. It was completely indigenous in nature and it was launched by a Soviet Rocket Kosmos 3-M.

question.content: When was the Indian Reform Association formed?

solution.content: 1870. Kesava Chandra Sen was the founder of the Indian Reform Association. He joined the Brahmo Samaj in 1857.

question.content: When was the construction of the Rashtrapati Bhavan completed?

solution.content: 1929. Rashtrapati Bhavan: The official residence of the President of India. Designed by Edwin Landseer Lutyens. It took 17 years to complete it.

question.content: The first Regional Rural Bank was established in India in the year:

solution.content: 1975. Prathama Bank was the first Regional Rural Bank established in India in 1975.

question.content: When was the Rovers Cup started?

solution.content: 1891. The Rovers Cup was a football tournament held in India. It was started by British football enthusiasts in Bombay.

question.content: When was incorporated? WhatsApp

solution.content: 1987. The SAARC Secretariat was established in Kathmandu. Its role is to coordinate and monitor the implementation of SAARC activities, service the meetings of the association and serve as the channel of communication between SAARC and other international organizations.

question.content: When was the Eden Gardens Stadium, Kolkata established?

solution.content: 1864. Eden Gardens Stadium is the oldest cricket stadium in India. World's biggest cricket stadium (As of August 2023) Narendra Modi stadium (earlier known as Sardar Patel Stadium).

question.content: When was Safari first released by Apple?

solution.content: 2003. A mobile version has been bundled with iOS devices since the iPhone's introduction in 2007.

question.content: In which year did UNESCO include Yoga in its Intangible Cultural Heritage list?

solution.content: 2016. UNESCO List of Intangible Cultural Heritage includes those intangible elements that help demonstrate diversity of cultural heritage and raise awareness about its importance.

question.content: In which year did the Dalai Lama cross over into India and take asylum?

solution.content: 1959. Dalai Lama fought his way through the snow to reach Chutangmu, a tiny Assam Rifles outpost near Tawang, to request asylum in India.

question.content: In which year was a separate Andhra state formed after the linguistic reorganization of the then Madras province?

solution.content: 2009. WhatsApp was founded by Brian Acton and Jan Koum. Sol.1924.(b) 1952. Freedom fighter Potti Sriramulu wanted the capital of Andhra Pradesh to be built in Rayalaseema. It

question.content: When was the Secretariat of the was due to his 58 day fast, a separate Andhra state was carved out of the erstwhile Madras Presidency with Kurnool as its capital.
When was the PIN Code (Postal Index Code) introduced in India?

solution.content: 1972. Postal Index Number code - Also known as Zip code or area postal code, Pin code is the post office numbering code system used by the postal service of India, India Post.

question.content: When was the Human Development Report first published?

solution.content: 1990. Human Development Report is an annual report published by the Human Development Report Office of the United Nations Development Programme.

question.content: Telangana became the 29th state of India in which year?

solution.content: 2014. In February 2014, Andhra Pradesh Reorganisation Act, 2014 bill was passed by the Parliament of India for the formation of Telangana state comprising ten districts from north-western Andhra Pradesh.

question.content: In which year was the 'Ramnath Goenka Excellence in Journalism' award instituted in India?

solution.content: 2006. Ramnath Goenka Excellence in Journalism' awards are given for both print journalism as well as broadcast journalism.

question.content: In which year was the Rigveda manuscript included in the UNESCO's Memory of the World Register?

solution.content: 2007. The Rigveda, the oldest among the four Vedas (Rigveda, Yajurveda, Samaveda and Atharvaveda).

question.content: When was the National Stock Exchange of India established?

solution.content: 1992. National Stock Exchange of India Limited is the leading stock exchange of India, located in Mumbai. It was the first dematerialized electronic exchange in the country.

question.content: In which year was the foundation stone for the Gateway of India laid in Bombay (now Mumbai)?

solution.content: 1913 (by then governor of Bombay, Sir George Sydenham Clarke). It was built in greeting the arrival of King-Emperor George V and Queen Mary, the first British monarch to visit India.

question.content: In which period was the legendary Victoria Terminus Station (currently Chhtarpati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus), Mumbai built?/

solution.content: 1878 to 1883. The Chhatrapati Shivaji station, formerly known as Victoria Terminus, was designed by the British architect F.W. Stevens.

question.content: In which year was the Currency Building in the BBD Bagh or Dalhousie area of Kolkata constructed?

solution.content: 1833. The beautiful colonial building was designed in Italian style with Venetian windows. This building was the office of the Reserve Bank of India till the year 1937.

question.content: In which year did D.C. Sircar publishes Indian Epigraphy and Indian Epigraphical Glossary?
In which of the following years were two additional Commissioners appointed to the Election commission of India for the first time?

solution.content: 1989. Originally the commission had only a Chief Election Commissioner. It currently consists of the Chief Election Commissioner and two Election Commissioners.

question.content: Which of the following years is called the Year of the Great Divide in the demographic history of India?

solution.content: 1921 is a "year of the great divide" in the demographic history of India when mortality started to decline leading to acceleration in the rate of population growth (the second stage).
